title: Road conditions worsen quickly in Saginaw County | Video | abc12.com
text: Road conditions worsen quickly in Saginaw County Weather Alert ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR SNOW-COVERED ROADWAYS AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES THROUGH THIS MORNING... WEATHER... * Moderate to briefly heavy snow will continue to impact the region through the morning hours. * Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches are possible in areas impacted through 11 am. Higher amounts will be dependent on locations that experience the more intense snowfall. * Southeast winds around 10 mph with gusts to 20 mph. * Air temperatures will range between 27 and 32 degrees. IMPACTS... * Accumulating snow will lead to slippery or snow covered roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. * Moderate to at times heavy snow will cause reductions of visibility to less than one mile. There may be rapid fluctuations of visibility. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...; * The combination of snow and cold temperatures will result in; slippery conditions, snow covered roads, and variable traffic; rates throughout the county. Motorists are urged to use caution; and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing; extra time.; * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Shiawassee, Genesee, Lapeer, St. Clair, Livingston, Oakland and Macomb Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Snow initially expands across the region through the rush hour commute, between 6 AM and 9 AM. Snow banding is possible particularly between the I-69 and I-94 corridors resulting in rates at or above 1 inch per hours. Total accumulations of 2 to 4 inches will be possible by late morning though a localized 5 inches can't be ruled out if higher rates are realized. A lull in snow is possible this afternoon south of M-59. A secondary window for snow is then expected through the evening and early nighttime hours when an additional 1 to 2 inches will again be possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and use caution while traveling. && Currently in Flint 27°F Snow 27°F / 24°F 10 AM 28°F 11 AM 29°F 12 PM 30°F 1 PM 32°F 2 PM 33°F Online Poll [ FanZone Championship: Kearsley v.
